byline.contributor: Sophia Kishkovsky contributed reporting from Moscow.

abstract: News Analysis; Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin will speak for first time in 10 years at United Nations General Assembly meeting, raising speculation on what he will say; many expect he will emphasize Islamic State’s battle against Syrian government, hopefully turning attention away from situation in Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: Recent military and diplomatic moves by President Vladimir V. Putin leading up to his speech at the United Nations are aimed as much at his domestic audience as the international front.

headline.main: On Syria, Putin Is Catering to an Audience at Home
headline.print_headline: By Focusing on Syria, Putin Is Catering to an Audience at Home

snippet: Recent military and diplomatic moves by President Vladimir V. Putin leading up to his speech at the United Nations are aimed as much at his domestic audience as the international front.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
